intro: Morinda stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf morinda, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and typically have five petals. Morinda stenophylla is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
